Magnetically-Controlled Organic Microbots Could Change Medicine in the Next Decade

Jun 10, 2018 • Dom Galeon

Extract

Tiny Doctors Google’s chief engineer and notable futurist Ray Kurzweil has said that nanobots or microbots will flow through our bodies by 2030. While the technology could be life-changing, the prospects for these nanobots are still limited by challenges in powering the micro devices and guiding them through the body. A team of researchers led by Li Zhang, a materials scientist from the Chinese University of Hong Kong in Shatin, may have found a solution to both problems. In a study published in the journal Science Robotics, Zhang and his colleagues turned to a type of miniature alga called Spirulina platensis, commonly used as a dietary supplement.

The key is coating the Spirulina with iron oxide nanoparticles. The helical or spring | tr ‘ ‘ ‘ ‘…
